ygData.subject: Can I alter how file names are renamed that have ? in them
ygData.msgSnippet: The default behavior Heritrix 1.10.2 is to just remove the ? when saving a file to the filesystem. I would like to subsitute the ? for something like

The default behavior Heritrix 1.10.2 is to just remove the ? when
saving a =
file to the filesystem. I would like to subsitute the '?' for
something lik=
e '_SUB_'. I am using MirrorWriter and do not believe it
is in that module =
that the stripping of the ? is happening as I do not
have entries under the=
 'character-map:' section. 

For example: 
When Heritrix crawls the followi=
ng url: 
http://mysite.org/myfolder/myfile.cfm?pic

It is saving it in the =
file system as:
mysite.org/myfolder/myfilepic.cfm
*Here I don't know if the=
 original URL was:
1)http://mysite.org/myfolder/myfile.cfm?pic
OR
2)http://=
mysite.org/myfolder/my.cfm?filepic

I would like to substitute something fo=
r the question mark rather than
just remove it, i.e. I did try using a 
mys=
ite.org/myfolder/myfile_SUB_pic.cfm

This way it would be easier to match f=
iles in the filesystem with the
entries in the crawl.log as there would be =
no ambiguity in where the
question mark existed in the original URL. 

Than=
ks,
Mike
